msContents.summary: F-43r The Revelaton of John, arranged for the days of the week, some with musical notation. has a colophon: "This book of Revelation was translated from Arabic to Egyptian, from Egyptian to Ge'ez by ዕንባቆም, the scholar of Dabra Libanos. Blessing with his servant, sinner ዘማርያም, his father, በላስዮስ (sic, Basiliyos?), ወልደ ሚካኤል, ዘሚካኤል, and his mother ወለተ ሐና, and his children, አምደ [ማርያም] and ወልደ ገብርኤል, ሰለመ ገብርኤል, ዜነ ግብርኤል [sic]." F-54v: Acts of Lalibela, Gädlä Lalibela, ገድለ፡ ላሊበላ፡. IES 5446. F-60v: Story of Mary, ነገረ፡ ማርያም።, incomplete at the end. -64v: Vision of John, Son of Thunder. On the Dual Virginity of Mary, incomplete at the end. F-98r: Chants called Mäwaś‘ǝt chants, መዋሥዕት። AṢZ 529–604. : excerpt of Prayer to Fanuel, written in a later hand. F-106v: Book of healing, መጽሐፈ: ፈውስ፡, "arranged by the disciples and 318 Orthodox Fathers." F: Commentary on Prayer of the Covenant. F-108v: Discussion of the Seven Signs from the Book of Revelation. F: Prescription for Protection in Travel. F-116v: Collection of Notes on Various Topics. mentions the owner, ዘማርያም, whose father is ወልደ ሚካኤል ዘሚካኤል, and his mother, ወለተ ሐና, his children, አምደ ማርያም, ወልደ ገብርኤል, ሰላመ ገብርኤል, ዜና ገብርኤል. mentions the owner and his father, በላስዮስ. identifies the writer as ዘማርያም and concludes with a curse on anyone who steals the book.
